articles.title: Kalshi sues Utah officials over comments made, anticipated regulation of prediction markets
articles.summary: Kalshi filed a lawsuit against Utah officials over public statements they made about prediction markets and expected regulatory crackdowns in the state. The legal action signals how seriously prediction market operators are taking state-level regulatory threats, especially when officials make public comments that could damage their business prospects.

articles.title: The worrying new gambling trend luring boys to bet on airstrikes, Epstein and aliens
articles.summary: Boys are increasingly placing bets on everything from military conflicts and conspiracy theories to extraterrestrial disclosure through unregulated online platforms. This trend signals how prediction markets are bleeding into pure gambling territory, potentially attracting regulatory crackdowns that could hurt legitimate forecasting platforms.

articles.title: How Prediction Market Traders Won on Domino's Earnings Miss
articles.summary: Prediction market traders correctly bet against Domino's before the pizza chain reported disappointing quarterly earnings that sent shares tumbling. The win showcases how savvy bettors can use corporate earnings prediction markets to profit from information asymmetries that traditional stock traders miss.

articles.title: Dustin Gouker answers our burning questions about prediction markets, emerging verticals
articles.summary: Dustin Gouker, a veteran sports betting analyst, breaks down the hottest prediction market verticals and where the action is heading next. His insights matter because he's tracked how betting markets evolve from niche to mainstream, and prediction markets are following the same playbook.

articles.title: Swalwell ally blocked from prediction market in California governor’s race
articles.summary: A political ally of Rep. Eric Swalwell got banned from betting on California's gubernatorial race on a major prediction market platform. The move signals platforms are getting more aggressive about blocking insider trading, which could reshape how political operatives and connected players approach these markets.

articles.title: How the ‘Mentions’ Prediction Markets Let You Bet on Trump’s Next Word
articles.summary: New "mentions" prediction markets allow bettors to wager on specific words or phrases Trump will say in his next speech or social media post. These hyper-granular markets represent the next frontier of political betting, turning every Trump utterance into a tradeable commodity that could attract massive volume from his obsessive follower base.

articles.title: 9 of the Most Bizarre Prediction Markets Open for State of the Union
articles.summary: Prediction markets are taking bets on everything from Biden's tie color to how many times he'll say "folks" during tonight's State of the Union address. These oddball props show how far betting markets have evolved beyond simple win-loss outcomes, creating new revenue streams while testing the boundaries of what people will actually wager on.

articles.title: Kalshi sues Utah officials over comments made, anticipated regulation of prediction markets
articles.summary: Kalshi is taking Utah officials to court over public statements they made about prediction markets and expected regulatory crackdowns in the state. This lawsuit signals prediction market operators are getting aggressive about fighting state-level interference before it kills their business in key markets.

articles.title: State of the Union odds: How long will Trump's speech last?
articles.summary: Sportsbooks are offering odds on how long Trump's State of the Union address will run, with bettors wagering on whether he'll stick to a typical 60-minute speech or drag it out past the 90-minute mark. The prop bet taps into Trump's well-documented tendency to go off-script and his love of holding an audience, making speech length one of the few political wagers where his personality quirks directly impact the outcome.

articles.title: Prediction market exchange Kalshi sues Utah over proposed prop betting ban
articles.summary: Kalshi has filed a lawsuit against Utah to block the state's proposed ban on proposition betting. The case could set crucial precedent for how states regulate prediction markets, potentially affecting whether other jurisdictions can restrict event-based trading that doesn't involve traditional sports gambling.

articles.title: Kalshi sues to block Utah from cracking down on prediction markets
articles.summary: Kalshi filed a lawsuit against Utah to prevent the state from restricting or banning prediction market operations within its borders. The case could set a crucial legal precedent for how states regulate prediction markets, potentially determining whether platforms can operate nationwide or face a patchwork of conflicting state laws.

articles.title: Prediction Markets Are Bracing for a Marathon Trump Speech
articles.summary: Prediction markets are preparing for another lengthy Trump address, with traders positioning themselves around the potential duration and content of his remarks. Long Trump speeches historically move markets on everything from policy announcements to off-script moments that create new betting opportunities.
